chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
P: (nat * list (bsm_instr n))%type
i: nat
x: pos n
q: nat
p: nat
v: Vector.t (list bool) n
st: (nat * Vector.t (list bool) n)%type

Goal:
(i, POP x p q :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = nil -> P // (q, v) ->> st -> P // (i, v) ->> st

Premises:
POP : forall n : nat, pos n -> nat -> nat -> bsm_instr n
Inductive bsm_instr (n : nat) : Set := bsm_pop : pos n -> nat -> nat -> bsm_instr n | bsm_push : pos n -> bool -> bsm_instr n Arguments bsm_instr _%nat_scope Arguments bsm_pop [n]%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments bsm_push [n]%nat_scope _ _%bool_scope
Module Vector := Struct Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, t A n -> t A (S n) Definition t_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Type), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t. Definition t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Prop), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Notation pos := Fin.t
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
in_bsm_sss_pop_E : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)
bsm_sss_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n -> Prop), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])) ->...-> P b b0 b1
bsm_sss_sind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n -> SProp), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])) ->...-> P b b0 b1
Inductive bsm_sss (n : nat) : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n -> Prop := in_bsm_sss_pop_E : forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v) | in_bsm_sss_pop_0 : forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x]) | in_bsm_sss_pop_1 : forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (...
in_bsm_sss_pop_0 : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])
in_bsm_sss_pop_1 : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = One :: ll -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x])

VectorSpec.splitat_append : forall (v0 : vec ?A ?n) (w : vec ?A ?m), VectorDef.splitat ?n (VectorDef.append v0 w) = (v0, w) where ?A : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- nat] ?m : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- nat]
VectorSpec.append_comm_cons : forall (v0 : vec ?A ?n) (w : vec ?A ?m) (a : ?A), a ## VectorDef.append v0 w = VectorDef.append (a ## v0) w where ?A : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- nat] ?m : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- nat]
VectorSpec.eta : forall v0 : vec ?A (S ?n), v0 = VectorDef.hd v0 ## VectorDef.tl v0 where ?A : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- nat]
VectorSpec.uncons_cons : forall (a : ?A) (v0 : vec ?A ?n), VectorDef.uncons (a ## v0) = (a, v0) where ?A : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- nat]
bsm_state = fun n : nat => (nat * vec (list bool) n)%type : nat -> Set Arguments bsm_state _%nat_scope
VectorDef.splitat : forall l r : nat, vec ?A (l + r) -> vec ?A l * vec ?A r where ?A : [n : nat P : nat * list (bsm_instr n) i : nat x : pos n p : nat q : nat v : vec (list bool) n st : nat * vec (list bool) n |- Type]
in_bsm_sss_push : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (b : bool) (v : vec (list bool) n), bsm_sss (PUSH x b) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(b :: v#>x)/x])
bsm_sss_stall : forall (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (s : nat * vec (list bool) n), sss_step_stall (bsm_sss (n:=n)) P s -> out_code (fst s) P
subcode_cons_inj : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) (P : code X), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
BSM_HALTING = fun P : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (i, s0) := s in let (P0, v) := s0 in sss_terminates (bsm_sss (n:=n)) (i, P0) (i, v) : BSM_PROBLEM -> Prop
sss_loop_complete : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop), (forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : nat * data), one_step i s t1 -> one_step i s t2 -> t1 = t2) -> forall (P : nat * list instr) (pre : data -> Prop) (spec : data -> data -> Prop) (f : data -> data), (forall x : data, x <> f x) -> forall C1 C2 : data -> Prop, (forall x : data, pre x -> {C1 x} + {C2 x}) -> forall i p : nat, out_code p P ->...-> p = q /\ (exists n : nat, C2 (iter f x n) /\ spec (iter f x n) y)
sss_stall_step_0 : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (q : nat) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_steps one_step P q st st' -> q = 0 /\ st = st'
sss_stall_step_stall : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (st : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_step_stall one_step P st
subcode_app_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (Q1 Q2 : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1 ++ Q2) -> (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1) \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (length Q1 + j, Q2)
sss_loop_sound : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (pre : data -> Prop) (spec : data -> data -> Prop) (f : data -> data) (C1 C2 : data -> Prop), (forall x : data, pre x -> {C1 x} + {C2 x}) -> forall i p : nat, (forall x : data, pre x -> C1 x -> sss_compute one_step P (i, x) (i, f x) /\ pre (f x)) ->...-> exists (n : nat) (y : data), sss_compute one_step P (i, x) (p, y) /\ spec (iter f x n) y
sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (ii : instr) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_step one_step P st st' -> one_step ii st st'
in_code_subcode : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : code X), in_code i P -> exists a : X, (i, a :: nil) <sc P
code = fun X : Type => (nat * list X)%type : Type -> Type Arguments code _%type_scope
subcode_cons_invert_left : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i : nat) (I : X) (l : list X), (i, I :: l) <sc Q -> (i, I :: nil) <sc Q /\ (S i, l) <sc Q
bsm_sss_fun : forall (i : bsm_instr n) (s t1 t2 : bsm_state n), i // s -1> t1 -> i // s -1> t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_step_stall_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (st : nat * data), sss_step_stall one_step P st -> {ii : instr | (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P /\ sss_stall one_step ii st} + {out_code (fst st) P}
subcode_cons_invert_right : forall (X : Type) (j : nat) (J : X) (Q : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, J :: Q) -> i = j /\ I = J \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (S j, Q)
subcode_sss_steps_stop : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (i : instr) (k : nat) (st1 st2 : nat * data), (forall st : nat * data, ~ one_step i st1 st) -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> sss_steps one_step P k st1 st2 -> k = 0 /\ st1 = st2

```coq
intros Hsubcode Hnil Hsteps.
apply sss_step_subcode_inv in Hsubcode as Hstep.
- inversion Hstep as [Hpop | ? ? ? ? Hpop ?].
  + inversion Hpop.
  + apply in_bsm_sss_pop_E with (v:=v) in Hpop as Hbv.
    * inversion Hbv. exact Hsteps.
    * exact Hnil.
- assumption.
Qed.
```

original: intros Hsubcode Hnil Hsteps. apply sss_step_subcode_inv in Hsubcode as Hstep. - inversion Hstep as [Hpop | ? ? ? ? Hpop ?]. + inversion Hpop. + apply in_bsm_sss_pop_E with (v:=v) in Hpop as Hbv. * inversion Hbv. apply Hsteps. * apply Hnil. - auto.
